channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Europe
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Russia is bruised as winter approaches. Can Ukraine land another blow?
Germany
Russia
Ukraine
Are cell phone calls on airplane flights inevitable?
item.description: Ah, holiday travel. Between huge crowds and weather delays, flying during this time of year is hectic. Now close your eyes and imagine the entire scenario with one additional annoyance: Loud talkers yammering into their cell phones at 35,000 feet.

item.title: 'Hamlet' in the skies? The story behind Taiwan's newest airline
item.description: Debuting its first flights in January 2020, Taiwanese start-up STARLUX Airlines could be the first new player in 30 years to upend the island's duopoly aviation market.

item.title: Copenhagen's new Metro is a thing of beauty
item.description: In Copenhagen, traffic is usually caused by the two-wheel variety of transportation: the bicycle.

item.title: The hotel designed for likes
The best luxury bars in Budapest
Budapest 's fine dining revolution
Luxury atop one of the world's tallest hotels
item.description: From traditional souks, mosques and UNESCO World Heritage sites, to futuristic skyscrapers, Baku, capital of Azerbaijan, offers an eclectic mix of old and new.

item.title: They say he lived to be 168. Here's how
item.description: There are a number of destinations around the world famed for the longevity of their residents.

item.title: This fire has been burning for 4,000 years
item.description: "This fire has burned 4,000 years and never stopped," says Aliyeva Rahila. "Even the rain coming here, snow, wind -- it never stops burning."

item.title: Water supply and metro services restored in Kyiv after missile attacks but many remain without heat
item.description: Water supply and metro services have been restored in Kyiv but officials continued to work Saturday to return heating to all the Ukrainian capital's residents, a day after a barrage of Russian missiles targeted the city.

item.title: December 16, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
item.description: Russia launched at least 76 missiles at Ukraine on Friday, according to the Ukrainian armed forces, disrupting power and water supplies across the country.

item.title: Russian missile strikes pound Ukraine, knocking out power and putting entire country under air-raid alarm
item.description: A fresh barrage of Russian missile attacks across Ukraine on Friday morning put the entire country under air-raid alarm and sent people scrambling for shelter as explosions sounded overhead, with strikes hitting critical infrastructure and knocking out power.

item.title: 'Apocalyptic' fire rips through French apartment block, killing 10
item.description: At least 10 people, including five children, were killed when a massive fire ripped through an eight-story apartment block in a suburb of the French city of Lyon early Friday morning.

item.title: December 15, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
item.description: US Congress passed a massive defense spending bill that includes $800 million in support for Ukraine. Follow here for live updates.

item.title: Exploding gift sends Polish police chief to hospital after Ukraine visit
item.description: Poland's police chief Jaroslaw Szymczyk was hospitalized with minor injuries on Wednesday after a gift that he had received in Ukraine suddenly exploded, according to a government statement

item.title: Ukraine launches 'most massive strike' on occupied Donetsk region since 2014, Russia-installed mayor says
item.description: Ukrainian forces have unleashed the biggest attack on the occupied Donetsk region since 2014, according to a Russia-installed official, in the wake of heavy fighting in the east of the country.

item.title: December 14, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
item.description: Ukrainian air defense forces shot down 13 Iranian-made drones over Kyiv, President Volodymyr Zelensky said, following a barrage of Russian strikes on the capital.

item.title: It's no great surprise that the European Parliament is engulfed in a corruption scandal
item.description: The European Union has spent the past few days reeling from one of the worst scandals to hit Brussels in decades.

item.title: UK government eyes ban on single-use plastic plates and cutlery
item.description: Single-use plastic cutlery, plates and other items are set to be banned by the UK government and replaced by biodegradable items as it seeks to tackle the country's -- and the world's -- growing plastic waste problem.

item.title: 'There are maniacs who enjoy killing,' Russian defector says of his former unit accused of war crimes in Bucha
item.description: Nikita Chibrin says he still remembers his fellow Russian soldiers running away after allegedly raping two Ukrainian women during their deployment northwest of Kyiv in March.

item.title: December 13, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
item.description: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send an advanced long-range air defense system to Ukraine to help counter Russian attacks, according to US officials.

item.title: Freed Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout says he 'wholeheartedly' supports Ukraine war and would volunteer if he could
item.description: Freed Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout said on Saturday he "wholeheartedly" supports Moscow's so-called "military operation" in Ukraine and that if he had the opportunity and necessary skills, he would "certainly go as a volunteer."

item.title: December 12, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
item.description: The Group of Seven leaders pledged "unwavering support" to Ukraine by promising assistance with military and air defense systems.

item.title: Leaving his life in Bakhmut had seemed impossible. Now he's lost a friend, a limb and a livelihood
item.description: The streets outside Vyacheslav Tarasov's home on Ukraine's eastern frontline are pocked by shell blasts. The buildings around are mostly empty, windowless and cold.

item.title: Pan Am Flight 103: The story of the UK's deadliest terror attack
item.description: The bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 may have taken place more than 30 years ago, but the appearance of alleged bombmaker Abu Agila Mohammad Mas'ud Kheir Al-Marimi in a US court on Monday has sparked a new wave of interest in the attack.
